segment.source: DISM App Package (.appx or .appxbundle) Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM App Package (.appx or .appxbundle) Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: DISM App Package (.appx or .appxbundle) Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM App Package (.appx or .appxbundle) Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: DISM App Package (.appx or .appxbundle) Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM App Package (.appx or .appxbundle) Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: You can use app package-servicing commands to add, remove, and list provisioned app packages (.appx or .appxbundle) in a Windows image.
segment.target: You can use app package-servicing commands to add, remove, and list provisioned app packages (.appx or .appxbundle) in a Windows image.

segment.source: An .appxbundle, new for Windows 10, is a collection of app and resource packages used together to enrich the app experience, while minimizing the disk footprint on a given PC.
segment.target: An .appxbundle, new for Windows 10, is a collection of app and resource packages used together to enrich the app experience, while minimizing the disk footprint on a given PC.

segment.source: For detailed documentation about .appxbundle packages and the Store pipeline, see App packaging.
segment.target: For detailed documentation about .appxbundle packages and the Store pipeline, see App packaging.

segment.source: Only a subset of the packages within an .appxbundle might be added to the image when a bundle is provisioned using DISM.
segment.target: Only a subset of the packages within an .appxbundle might be added to the image when a bundle is provisioned using DISM.

segment.source: For more information, see Understanding How DISM Adds .appxbundle Resource Packages to an Image.
segment.target: For more information, see Understanding How DISM Adds .appxbundle Resource Packages to an Image.

segment.source: Provisioned app packages are added to a Windows image and are then installed for every new or existing user profile the next time the user logs on.
segment.target: Provisioned app packages are added to a Windows image and are then installed for every new or existing user profile the next time the user logs on.

segment.source: For more information, including requirements for app package provisioning, see Sideload Apps with DISM.
segment.target: For more information, including requirements for app package provisioning, see Sideload Apps with DISM.

segment.source: You can also use PowerShell to add, remove, and list app packages (.appx or .appxbundle) per image or per user in a Windows installation.
segment.target: You can also use PowerShell to add, remove, and list app packages (.appx or .appxbundle) per image or per user in a Windows installation.

segment.source: For more information, see Deployment Imaging Servicing Management (DISM) Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell and App Installation Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information, see Deployment Imaging Servicing Management (DISM) Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell and App Installation Cmdlets in Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: The base syntax for servicing a Windows image using DISM is:
segment.target: The base syntax for servicing a Windows image using DISM is:

segment.source: DISM.exe {/Image:pathtoimagedirectory/Online} dismglobaloptions {servicingoption} servicingargument
segment.target: DISM.exe {/Image:pathtoimagedirectory/Online} dismglobaloptions {servicingoption} servicingargument

segment.source: The following app package (.appx or .appxbundle) servicing options are available for an offline image.
segment.target: The following app package (.appx or .appxbundle) servicing options are available for an offline image.

segment.source: The following app package (.appx or .appxbundle) servicing options are available for a running operating system.
segment.target: The following app package (.appx or .appxbundle) servicing options are available for a running operating system.

segment.source: App package servicing options
segment.target: App package servicing options

segment.source: This section describes how you can use each app servicing option.
segment.target: This section describes how you can use each app servicing option.

segment.source: These options are not case sensitive.
segment.target: These options are not case sensitive.

segment.source: /Get-Help /?
segment.target: /Get-Help /?

segment.source: When used immediately after an app package servicing command-line option, information about the option and the arguments is displayed.
segment.target: When used immediately after an app package servicing command-line option, information about the option and the arguments is displayed.

segment.source: Additional topics might become available when an image is specified.
segment.target: Additional topics might become available when an image is specified.

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:testoffline /Add- ProvisionedAppxPackages /?
segment.target: Dism /image:C:testoffline /Add- ProvisionedAppxPackages /?

segment.source: Dism /online /Get-ProvisionedAppxPackages /?
segment.target: Dism /online /Get-ProvisionedAppxPackages /?

segment.source: /Get-ProvisionedAppxPackages
segment.target: /Get-ProvisionedAppxPackages

segment.source: Displays information about app packages (.appx or .appxbundle), in an image, that are set to install for each new user.
segment.target: Displays information about app packages (.appx or .appxbundle), in an image, that are set to install for each new user.

segment.source: Dism /Image:C:testoffline /Get-ProvisionedAppxPackages
segment.target: Dism /Image:C:testoffline /Get-ProvisionedAppxPackages

segment.source: /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage { /FolderPath: Appfolderpath/SkipLicense/CustomDataPath: customfilepath | /PackagePath: mainpackagepath/DependencyPackagePath: dependencypackagepath {/LicenseFile: licensefilepath/SkipLicense} /CustomDataPath: customfilepath }
segment.target: /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage { /FolderPath: Appfolderpath/SkipLicense/CustomDataPath: customfilepath | /PackagePath: mainpackagepath/DependencyPackagePath: dependencypackagepath {/LicenseFile: licensefilepath/SkipLicense} /CustomDataPath: customfilepath }

segment.source: Adds one or more app packages to the image.
segment.target: Adds one or more app packages to the image.

segment.source: The app will be added to the Windows image and registered for each existing or new user profile the next time the user logs in.
segment.target: The app will be added to the Windows image and registered for each existing or new user profile the next time the user logs in.

segment.source: If the app is added to an online image, the app will not be registered for the current user until the next time the user logs in.
segment.target: If the app is added to an online image, the app will not be registered for the current user until the next time the user logs in.

segment.source: Use /FolderPath to specify a folder of unpacked app files containing a main package, any dependency packages, and the license file.
segment.target: Use /FolderPath to specify a folder of unpacked app files containing a main package, any dependency packages, and the license file.

segment.source: This is only supported for an unpacked app package.
segment.target: This is only supported for an unpacked app package.

segment.source: Use /PackagePath to specify an app package (.appx or .appxbundle).
segment.target: Use /PackagePath to specify an app package (.appx or .appxbundle).

segment.source: You can use /PackagePath when provisioning a line-of-business app online.
segment.target: You can use /PackagePath when provisioning a line-of-business app online.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Use the /PackagePath parameter to provision .appxbundle packages.
segment.target: Use the /PackagePath parameter to provision .appxbundle packages.

segment.source: /PackagePath is not supported from a host PC that is running Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) 4.0, Windows Server 2008 R2, or an earlier version of Windows.
segment.target: /PackagePath is not supported from a host PC that is running Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) 4.0, Windows Server 2008 R2, or an earlier version of Windows.

segment.source: If the package has dependencies that are architecture-specific, you must install all of the applicable architectures for the dependency on the target image.
segment.target: If the package has dependencies that are architecture-specific, you must install all of the applicable architectures for the dependency on the target image.

segment.source: For example, on an x64 target image, include a path to both the x86 and x64 dependency packages or include them both in the folder of unpacked app files.
segment.target: For example, on an x64 target image, include a path to both the x86 and x64 dependency packages or include them both in the folder of unpacked app files.

segment.source: Computer Architecture
segment.target: Computer Architecture

segment.source: Dependencies to install:
segment.target: Dependencies to install:

segment.source: x64 and x86
segment.target: x64 and x86

segment.source: ARM
segment.target: ARM

segment.source: Windows RT (ARM) only
segment.target: Windows RT (ARM) only

segment.source: Use /CustomDataPath to specify an optional custom data file for an app.
segment.target: Use /CustomDataPath to specify an optional custom data file for an app.

segment.source: You can specify any file name.
segment.target: You can specify any file name.

segment.source: The file will be renamed to Custom.dat when it is added to the image.
segment.target: The file will be renamed to Custom.dat when it is added to the image.

segment.source: Use /LicensePath with the /PackagePath option to specify the location of the .xml file containing your application license.
segment.target: Use /LicensePath with the /PackagePath option to specify the location of the .xml file containing your application license.

segment.source: Only use /SkipLicense with apps that do not require a license on a sideloading-enabled computer.
segment.target: Only use /SkipLicense with apps that do not require a license on a sideloading-enabled computer.

segment.source: Using /SkipLicense in other scenarios can compromise an image.
segment.target: Using /SkipLicense in other scenarios can compromise an image.

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: Dism /Image:C:testoffline /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage /FolderPath:c:TestAppsMyUnpackedApp /CustomDataPath:c:TestAppsCustomData.xml
segment.target: Dism /Image:C:testoffline /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage /FolderPath:c:TestAppsMyUnpackedApp /CustomDataPath:c:TestAppsCustomData.xml

segment.source: Dism /Online /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage /PackagePath:C:TestAppsMyPackedAppMainPackage.appx /DependencyPackagePath:C:TestAppsMyPackedAppFramework-x86.appx /DependencyPackagePath:C:TestAppsMyPackedAppFramework-x64.appx /LicensePath:C:TestAppsMyLicense.xml
segment.target: Dism /Online /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage /PackagePath:C:TestAppsMyPackedAppMainPackage.appx /DependencyPackagePath:C:TestAppsMyPackedAppFramework-x86.appx /DependencyPackagePath:C:TestAppsMyPackedAppFramework-x64.appx /LicensePath:C:TestAppsMyLicense.xml

segment.source: Dism /Online /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage /FolderPath:C:TestAppsMyUnpackedApp /SkipLicense
segment.target: Dism /Online /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage /FolderPath:C:TestAppsMyUnpackedApp /SkipLicense

segment.source: Dism /Image:C:testoffline /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage /PackagePath:C:TestAppsMyPackedAppMainPackage.appxbundle /SkipLicense
segment.target: Dism /Image:C:testoffline /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage /PackagePath:C:TestAppsMyPackedAppMainPackage.appxbundle /SkipLicense

segment.source: /Remove-ProvisionedAppxPackage /PackageName: PackageName
segment.target: /Remove-ProvisionedAppxPackage /PackageName: PackageName

segment.source: Removes provisioning for app packages (.appx or .appxbundle) from the image.
segment.target: Removes provisioning for app packages (.appx or .appxbundle) from the image.

segment.source: App packages will not be registered to new user accounts that are created.
segment.target: App packages will not be registered to new user accounts that are created.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: This option will only remove the provisioning for a package if it is registered to any user profile.
segment.target: This option will only remove the provisioning for a package if it is registered to any user profile.

segment.source: Use the Remove-AppxPackage cmdlet in PowerShell to remove the app for each user that it is already registered to in order to fully remove the app from the image.
segment.target: Use the Remove-AppxPackage cmdlet in PowerShell to remove the app for each user that it is already registered to in order to fully remove the app from the image.

segment.source: If the app has not been registered to any user profile, the /Remove-ProvisionedAppxPackage option will remove the package completely.
segment.target: If the app has not been registered to any user profile, the /Remove-ProvisionedAppxPackage option will remove the package completely.

segment.source: To remove app packages from a Windows Server 2012 image that has the Desktop Experience installed, you must remove the app packages before you remove the Desktop Experience.
segment.target: To remove app packages from a Windows Server 2012 image that has the Desktop Experience installed, you must remove the app packages before you remove the Desktop Experience.

segment.source: The Desktop Experience is a requirement of the /Remove-ProvisionedAppxPackage option for Server Core installations of Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: The Desktop Experience is a requirement of the /Remove-ProvisionedAppxPackage option for Server Core installations of Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: Dism /Image:C:testoffline /Remove-ProvisionedAppxPackage /PackageName:microsoft.devx.appx.app11.0.0.0neutralac4zc6fex2zjp
segment.target: Dism /Image:C:testoffline /Remove-ProvisionedAppxPackage /PackageName:microsoft.devx.appx.app11.0.0.0neutralac4zc6fex2zjp

segment.source: /Set-ProvisionedAppxDataFile /CustomDataPath: customfilepath /PackageName: PackageName
segment.target: /Set-ProvisionedAppxDataFile /CustomDataPath: customfilepath /PackageName: PackageName

segment.source: Adds a custom data file into the specified app package (.appx or .appxbundle).
segment.target: Adds a custom data file into the specified app package (.appx or .appxbundle).

segment.source: The specified app (.appx or .appxbundle) package must already be added to the image prior to when you add the custom data file with this option.
segment.target: The specified app (.appx or .appxbundle) package must already be added to the image prior to when you add the custom data file with this option.

segment.source: You can also add a custom data file when you use the /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage option.
segment.target: You can also add a custom data file when you use the /Add-ProvisionedAppxPackage option.

segment.source: Use /CustomDataPath to specify an optional custom data file for an app.
segment.target: Use /CustomDataPath to specify an optional custom data file for an app.

segment.source: You can specify any file name.
segment.target: You can specify any file name.

segment.source: The file will be renamed to Custom.dat when it is added to the image.
segment.target: The file will be renamed to Custom.dat when it is added to the image.

segment.source: If a Custom.dat file already exists, it will be overwritten.
segment.target: If a Custom.dat file already exists, it will be overwritten.

segment.source: Use /PackageName to specify an app package (.appx or .appxbundle).
segment.target: Use /PackageName to specify an app package (.appx or .appxbundle).

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: DISM.exe /Image:C:testoffline /Set-ProvisionedAppxDataFile /CustomDataPath:c:TestAppsCustom.dat /PackageName:microsoft.appx.app11.0.0.0neutralac4zc6fex2zjp
segment.target: DISM.exe /Image:C:testoffline /Set-ProvisionedAppxDataFile /CustomDataPath:c:TestAppsCustom.dat /PackageName:microsoft.appx.app11.0.0.0neutralac4zc6fex2zjp

segment.source: Understanding How DISM Adds .appxbundle Resource Packages to an Image
segment.target: Understanding How DISM Adds .appxbundle Resource Packages to an Image

segment.source: When an .appxbundle is added to the image, not all resource packages within the bundle are applicable.
segment.target: When an .appxbundle is added to the image, not all resource packages within the bundle are applicable.

segment.source: For example, if an app is being added to a Windows image with a Spanish (Spain) default language, French (France) resources should not be included.
segment.target: For example, if an app is being added to a Windows image with a Spanish (Spain) default language, French (France) resources should not be included.

segment.source: To determine what resources are added to the image, the package applicability is determined using:
segment.target: To determine what resources are added to the image, the package applicability is determined using:

segment.source: Language Resource Packs: If an operating system language is not present, the corresponding app language resource pack is not added.
segment.target: Language Resource Packs: If an operating system language is not present, the corresponding app language resource pack is not added.

segment.source: For example, you might have an image that is a Windows 10 with English (US) as the default language, and a Spanish (Spain) language pack included.
segment.target: For example, you might have an image that is a Windows 10 with English (US) as the default language, and a Spanish (Spain) language pack included.

segment.source: English (US) and Spanish (Spain) app resource packs will be added to the image.
segment.target: English (US) and Spanish (Spain) app resource packs will be added to the image.

segment.source: If a French (France) resource pack (or any other language) is available in the app bundle, it will not be added.
segment.target: If a French (France) resource pack (or any other language) is available in the app bundle, it will not be added.

segment.source: Scale and DirectX (DXFL) Resource Packs: Scale and DirectX (DXFL) resource packs depend upon the hardware configuration of the Windows device.
segment.target: Scale and DirectX (DXFL) Resource Packs: Scale and DirectX (DXFL) resource packs depend upon the hardware configuration of the Windows device.

segment.source: Because the type of target hardware can’t be known at the time the DISM commands are run, all scale and DXFL resource packages are added to the image at provisioning time.
segment.target: Because the type of target hardware can’t be known at the time the DISM commands are run, all scale and DXFL resource packages are added to the image at provisioning time.

segment.source: For more information about developing an app with scaling resources, see Guidelines for scaling to pixel density (Windows Store apps).
segment.target: For more information about developing an app with scaling resources, see Guidelines for scaling to pixel density (Windows Store apps).

segment.source: For an image containing multiple language packs, app resource packages will be added to the image for each language.
segment.target: For an image containing multiple language packs, app resource packages will be added to the image for each language.

segment.source: Once the first user has signed in to the PC with the deployed image and the user has chosen a language during OOBE, the inapplicable resource packages, (language resource packs, scale resource packs and DXFL resource packages) that do not match the user profile settings are removed.
segment.target: Once the first user has signed in to the PC with the deployed image and the user has chosen a language during OOBE, the inapplicable resource packages, (language resource packs, scale resource packs and DXFL resource packages) that do not match the user profile settings are removed.

segment.source: For example, an app might support English (US), French (France), and Spanish (Spain) languages.
segment.target: For example, an app might support English (US), French (France), and Spanish (Spain) languages.

segment.source: If the app is added to an image with English (US) and Spanish (Spain) language packs present, only English (US) and Spanish (Spain) resource packs will be added these to the image.
segment.target: If the app is added to an image with English (US) and Spanish (Spain) language packs present, only English (US) and Spanish (Spain) resource packs will be added these to the image.

segment.source: Then, if a user signs in for the first time and, during OOBE, selects English (US) as their operating system language, the Spanish (Spain) resource packages will be removed after sign in completes.
segment.target: Then, if a user signs in for the first time and, during OOBE, selects English (US) as their operating system language, the Spanish (Spain) resource packages will be removed after sign in completes.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you add or remove a language pack from an image, you change the applicability context which may result in leaving an incorrect or incomplete set of resource packages in the image.
segment.target: If you add or remove a language pack from an image, you change the applicability context which may result in leaving an incorrect or incomplete set of resource packages in the image.

segment.source: When a language pack is added or removed, you must, once again, add all .appxbundle packages (including any dependency packages and Windows Store license file) to the image.
segment.target: When a language pack is added or removed, you must, once again, add all .appxbundle packages (including any dependency packages and Windows Store license file) to the image.

segment.source: This will ensure that the correct set of resource packages is provisioned.
segment.target: This will ensure that the correct set of resource packages is provisioned.

segment.source: Limitations
segment.target: Limitations

segment.source: You cannot install an app package (.appx) on an operating system that does not support Windows 8 apps.
segment.target: You cannot install an app package (.appx) on an operating system that does not support Windows 8 apps.

segment.source: You can’t install an app bundle package (.appxbundle) on an operating system that does not support at least Windows 8.1 apps.
segment.target: You can’t install an app bundle package (.appxbundle) on an operating system that does not support at least Windows 8.1 apps.

segment.source: Apps aren't supported on WinPE 4.0, the Windows Server 2012 Server Core installation option, or on any versions of Windows older than Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: Apps aren't supported on WinPE 4.0, the Windows Server 2012 Server Core installation option, or on any versions of Windows older than Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: To install and run apps on Windows Server 2012, you must install the Desktop Experience.
segment.target: To install and run apps on Windows Server 2012, you must install the Desktop Experience.

segment.source: The /FolderPath option is only supported for app packages based on the .appx format.
segment.target: The /FolderPath option is only supported for app packages based on the .appx format.

segment.source: /PackagePath must always be used for .appxbundle packages.
segment.target: /PackagePath must always be used for .appxbundle packages.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: What is DISM?

segment.target: DISM Image Management Command-Line Options

segment.target: Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Command-Line Options
